name:
Internet of Things and real-time
computing
description:
We live in a data-driven world, where multiple devices around us measure all
kind of physical magnitudes and communicate to each other. In order to be
useful, these devices must be able to operate in real time. The talk will
provide an introduction on the constraints that real time computing present
for IoT devices and will describe real-time operating systems and what we can
expect from them.
instructorDescription: Antonio Luque is the IEEE Region 8 Director elected in 2019. He currently holds the position of Associate Professor in the Department of Electronics Engineering, University of Seville. He has authored 20 journal papers, 40 conference papers, 3 book chapters, and a textbook, in addition to supervising two PhD students.

name: EMBS Chapter/Membership Opportunities for Students and YPs
description:
IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society (EMBS) is the world’s largest
international society of biomedical engineers. This talk will introduce the technical
communities and events organized within EMBS, then focus on:
- benefits of becoming a member for students and YPs, volunteering opportunities
through Members and Student Activities Committee
- how to establish a student chapter/club within EMBS, and benefits such as funding,
awards, distinguished lecturer program etc.
instructorDescription: Andre Cakici is currently an M.Sc. student at the Department of Medical Engineering, Friedrich-Alexander Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg. He served as a student representative at EMBS Turkey Chapter. He is currently the AdCom Student Representative for the IEEE engineering in Medicine and Biology Society.

name: Healthcare Innovation and Entrepreneurship
description:
The aim of this course is to provide an intensive and practical introduction to the process
of understanding significant unmet medical needs and designing new medical
technologies to address them. We focus on strategies for understanding and interpreting
clinical needs, performing market assessments, and designing two basic prototypes in the
areas of Cancer Brain Chip and Implantable Brain System
instructorDescription: Metin Akay received his B.S. and M.S. in Electrical Engineering from the Bogazici University, Istanbul, Turkey in 1981 and 1984, respectively and a Ph.D. degree from Rutgers University in 1990. He is currently the founding chair of the new Biomedical Engineering Department and the John S. Dunn professor of biomedical engineering at the University of Houston.

name: Introduction to ERP and SAP
description: How you gather, manage, and use information will determine whether you win or lose.
instructorDescription: Seif El HAJJEM is a Tunisian Industrial Engineer graduated from ENIT, the National Engineering School of Tunis, in 2015. Currently, he's an SAP (System Application Products) Functional Consultant at WYNSYS Tunisia, where he has been involved in the roll-out and implementation of SAP for multiple companies in different industry sectors. Seif volunteers for IEEE, where he is currently serving as IEEE Tunisia Section Vice-Chair for members activities, as a Member of the IEEE Region 8 Young Professionals Subcommittee and as a Vice Chair of the IEEE Region 8 Entrepreneurship Initiative Subcommittee.

name:
Introduction to Neuromuscular Interfaces: Applications for Human/Machine 
Interfaces and Neurophysiology
description:
The aim of this Workshops is to provide an intensive and practical introduction to 
neuromuscular interfaces and neuroengineering applications for studying the neural 
control of movement and developing human-centered assistive devices (e.g. 
neuroprostheses, exoskeletons). The acquisition, analysis, and interpretation of 
electrophysiological data (specifically electromyography - EMG) will be discussed in 
depth. A MATLAB demo will demonstrate the decomposition and processing of 
surface EMG signal. State-of-the-art research will be mentioned, and resources will 
be provided for those interested in this technical field.
instructorDescription: Andre Cakici is currently an M.Sc. student at the Department of Medical Engineering, Friedrich-Alexander Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg. He served as a student representative at EMBS Turkey Chapter. He is currently the AdCom Student Representative for the IEEE engineering in Medicine and Biology Society.

name: Advanced Corrosion monitoring systems
description: In the evolution of inspection programs, the fixed interval inspection strategy has been replaced by a condition-based monitoring approach. Condition-based monitoring is followed by risk-based inspection (RBI), where inspection programs are defined on a risk basis, considering damage mechanisms, failure probability and associated consequences. The use of new inspection technologies such as PAUT, TOFD, Remote Operated Vehicles (ROV) and Intelligent Pigging Inspection, etc. was able to make informed decisions regarding the remaining life of pressure systems and pipelines. In this Workshops, you will learn about advances in corrosion monitoring technologies. We will highlight how these new technologies can help provide the most effective data to manage and mitigate potential pressure vessels and pipelines integrity risks.
instructorDescription: Aymen Tmar is a Tunisian electromechanical engineer, who is currently an asset Integrity Engineer at Shell. He was the Chairman of IEEE PES ENIS Student Branch Chapter in 2014 and occupied the position of IEEE Tunisia Young Professionals AG chairman in 2019. He is currently the chair of IEEE IAS Tunisia Section chapter.

name: 2022 MGA Activities with a Spotlight on Students and Young Professionals
description: 2022 has been a productive year thus far for IEEE's Member and Geographic Activities (MGA) organization. MGA Vice President David Koehler and IEEE's Senior Director of Member Experience, Michael Kreisberg will highlight current MGA data and trends, focusing on Region 8.  They will share some of the exciting programs and activities that are impacting our Student and Young Professional member growth.  In addition, they will provide an overview of the MGA volunteer organizational structure and share the pathways that volunteers can take to enhance their engagement with IEEE.
instructorDescription: David Koehler is Vice President, Member and Geographic Activities at IEEE/Global

name: Energy Transition and Renewable Energy as a Young Professional
description: In the path toward net-zero, young professionals will play a crucial role in deploying and developing renewable energy for this transition. What does this mean in terms of the significant growth in green jobs and how can YPs look back at the 2020 - 2030 decade from 2050 and realise the implications of the actions we took?
instructorDescription: AbdulHameed has over 3 years of experience in the Energy sector, working with General Electric, Masdar Energy and Resilient Cities Network.  He is researching how to strengthen policies for the low-carbon transition at the University of Cambridge.
instructorHighlight: Engineering for Sustainable Development at University of Cambridge

name: Introduction to cybersecurity
description: In this Workshops we will explore the fundamental building blocks of cybersecurity and the most recent techniques used by red teamers and offensive security experts along with the most important resources to start your career in Cyber Security.
instructorDescription: Ahmed Belkahla is Studying Computer Science & Networks Engineering at the National Institute of Applied Science and Technology (INSAT) and is a Cyber Security Specialist at Yogosha. He occupied the position of vice chairman of Securinets and was the Media manager of IEEE CS INSAT Chapter in 2019.

name: ICT for Good, How can we utilize technology for humanity
description: With the rapid change in our lives and the huge role of technology in the digitalization of all aspects from industry to daily life, technology can also serve both the development and humanitarian needs and save our planet. In this session, we will tackle the concept of ICT4D from a theoretical aspect, alongside best practices of utilizing technologies, what technologies can be utilized for this, and sharing some skills in the effective planning, development, implementation and management of ICT4D initiatives. Adding to that, sharing some knowledge about existing initiatives in R8, and how they can be adapted to our local contexts to meet the local needs and prevent their potential risks and failures.
instructorDescription: Mr Shwehdy is specialized in utilizing ICT4D & Social Innovation & currently, he is pursuing his master's in eGovernance and Digital Transformation.
instructorHighlight: Mr Shwehdy, Amjad-Badr is a social entrepreneur, a digital nomad from Libya, passionate about technology & its applications, & advocates for digital transformation & rights and good governance.

name: Open discussion on Internet Governance
description: We always have these questions in our minds, "who owns the internet? how do they are managing it? what will happen to the world wide web in case of conflict?" and many other questions about connectivity and net neutrality; all these questions and more will be opened for discussion with the participants to come up with ideas and share some of the best practices on the internet governance both international and local efforts to tackle these issues and coordinate with all related stakeholders for the benefits of the citizens. Moreover, we will also focus on the efforts led by the Internet Governance Forum, what is it, and how SYP will join these task forces.
instructorDescription: Mr Shwehdy is specialized in utilizing ICT4D & Social Innovation & currently, he is pursuing his master's in eGovernance and Digital Transformation.
instructorHighlight: Mr Shwehdy, Amjad-Badr is a social entrepreneur, a digital nomad from Libya, passionate about technology & its applications, & advocates for digital transformation & rights and good governance.
